page.title: 07POW HOSTEL, CATWORTH, Cambs.
page.content:
PHOTOGRAPH C shows the gable end of what is left of this building, top of Fox Road, opposite "Racehorse" PH. Recently converted to sheep sheds and now used for general storage. Origin -ally built in 1940 as a hostel for Land Army girls, it was used to house first Italian Prisoners of War, then displaced persons, eg Latvians, who were employed by local farmers. One or two married local girls. On the death of one of the occupants in the early 1980s (buried at Catworth) the two remaining were rehoused locally, and parts of the structure demolished.
The hostel was supplied with water and electricity earlier than most of the rest of the village, also first sewage disposal works. One guard, now retired lives in Catworth (married local girl)
